intro: Funastrum bilobum, commonly known as the two-lobed funastrum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or a small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a slightly waxy texture, while the flowers are white or pale yellow. Funastrum bilobum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
